m_szDocSumamry: Directory:Wind Jump to: navigation , search Rather than increasing the size to generate more power, GE is designing longer blades and a more efficient drive train, making the turbine 25% more efficient. These next gen 4 MW units will be 300 feet tall and have a rotor diameter of 360 feet. GE hopes to release them in 2012 for offshore use in Europe. [1] Wind Power Compiled primarily by Sterling D. Allan Contents 16 See also Overviews       "The power of the wind has been overlooked.  Some day it will be forcibly brought to the position it deserves through the need of a substitute for the presen
